abstract: Neuroblastoma is an uncommon malignant neoplasm that derives from neural crest progenitor cells that normally give rise to the sympathetic nervous system. It represents 8 to 10% of all extracranial tumors in childhood. The purpose of this paper is to report a case in which a mandibular soft tissue mass was the initial presenting sign of disseminated neuroblastoma in a 2-year-old child, and to discuss the clinicopathologic features and biologic behavior of neuroblastoma.
title: Disseminated neuroblastoma with initial presentation as an intraoral mass: case report.
